website_summaries.verdict: Good price point for tough gloves that resist tears and provide chemical protection for forearms.
pros: Available in lengths between 14 and 22 inches from fingertip to cuff
Uses a high-quality latex material that resists chemicals
Has a nice thickness level, so you receive both protection and tactile feedback for working
Gloves are easier to put on and take off than you may think
cons: Gloves may crack when exposed to tough weather

customer_reviews.title: Hands haven't been dissolved
customer_reviews.text: Not once have my hands been dissolved in acid while wearing these gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Helixx

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: These are well made gloves. I use them when working in the yard where poison ivy is present. So far I've been very pleased. They are very roomy, so if you have huge hands, you will probably do just fine. I wear a ladies large or extra large gloves and these are really big on me. I'm using them for work where dexterity is of little importance, so it's not a big deal. If I needed dexterity, I'd need a much smaller hand size.
customer_reviews.author: motokat

customer_reviews.title: REALLY BIG extra large gloves tough enough for chemical baths
customer_reviews.text: The most important thing--these are extra large. I always order extra large gloves for myself and these were...extra large for me! They are substantially thicker than kitchen gloves, but are not suitable for solvents since they are latex. They do resist both acids and alkalis and are thick enough to avoid quick leaks although they are still only rubber, not something tougher. They are large enough to shake off, which is handy for grabbing things out of chemical baths, as you don't want to ever touch the working surfaces with your bare fingers unless the acids/alkalis are first neutralized. I do not recommend them for tasks where you need fine finger coordination as the thickness may interfere with your dexterity.
customer_reviews.author: Steven P. Spinella

customer_reviews.title: Open Cracks formed in gloves.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the size and length when working around pool skimmer clean out & chemicals. I just today noticed after having them less than two months that open cracks have formed all around the glove fingers and sleeves. I stored them in my closed pool chemical storage box even under a lid since they are advertised as being acid and alkaline resistant. I wonder why this would happen.
customer_reviews.author: Alan D Warren

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these since 2016. They used to be a great product, and as of the last 1.5 yrs, they took a major turn south. They are as if they are refurbished, very limp like a wet spaghetti noodle, used to be stiff and as far as the fit, took a dive also. The last 3 pair were so large that it was impossible to work with any dexterity. Pretty bad when they produce pinholes after a couple hours in dishwater, that is a fact I am very disappointed, my father is a lineman and I have seen refurbished gloves and we gotta dead ringer.
customer_reviews.author: Todd spendsalot

customer_reviews.title: Cracking and Falling Apart
customer_reviews.text: These are falling apart and cracking after just a few months of use. They are not built for much work. These might be ok for someone that does small hobby work, but if you use gloves a lot these are not the ones to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Peter T. Dixon D.B.S.

customer_reviews.title: Boy these didn't last long!
customer_reviews.text: I used these to pull out poison ivy - way too big to do any detail work. Then I wore them to strip paint using a mild paint stripper. After about an hour, I had a big hole in the palm of the right hand. Resists acid?? - I don't think so
customer_reviews.author: toimdawoim

customer_reviews.title: Better than what I need
customer_reviews.text: I bought these so that I could wear them to protect myself when emptying my black and grey tanks on a travel trailer. Ya know, keep my hands clean of the stuff coming down the poop chute. Turns out the travel trailer manufacturers are smarter than that. they designed it where all the stuff stays in the holding tank until you have the hose hooked up and pull the release valve to let the stuff out. so, no mess at all, but the gloves are good.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: No Durability
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to wear when cleaning the skimmer basket on my pool. They worked fine for about six uses. I stored them in an outdoor storage box near the pool so they were exposed to hot weather and some cold temperatures (as low as 35 degrees). They were never exposed to anything stronger than swimming pool water. Today, when I pulled them out to use, they were both cracked exposing holes. Reading the other reviews - this seems to be a common problem. I would not repurchase and can not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Croce

customer_reviews.title: TOO Large! Giant sized fit
customer_reviews.text: Like many others have said, unless you have long and incredibly swollen fingers, and Andre the Giant sized palms, this will not fit. The length of the cuff is great and the thickness makes it seem sturdy, but since the fingers cannot be remotely placed comfortably for a normal fit for any dexterity, it is not worth the money. If the width of your palm is at least 6" you may fit into this, idk about the fingers though... lol
customer_reviews.author: DCMinion

customer_reviews.title: Cracked
customer_reviews.text: Barely used to clean leaves out of pool skimmer and already cracked/leaking. Like to have gloves in cold weather to keep hands somewhat warm while cleaning pool and skimmers.
customer_reviews.author: fly like an eagle

customer_reviews.title: Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Worked good for the first TWO days of use but then it got a hole in the gloves from all the oil change i do at work so i won't never by again because the quality is no good on these gloves
customer_reviews.author: kevin b galvan

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: I got these so I could grab Amazon boxes from the front door to put them in the garage where they wait for 5 days before bringing in the house thanks to covid. These are perfect. They are really big and I can slip them on and off without touching the outside. They are very thick so I don’t worry about them ripping. I love these!
customer_reviews.author: A. Haman

customer_reviews.title: Not for household chores!
customer_reviews.text: My mistake. I bought these for household cleaning and chores but their exterior surface is so slippery I can't hold onto brushes or even wet sponges. They slip right out of my fingers. These are probably excellent gloves for handling dangerous chemicals. That was stated in the product description. I ignored the description because disposable gloves were impossible to find due to Covid-19. However, if you want some fun, buy a pair and see how many can hold onto an icicle while they run 20 feet.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Saved my hands...
customer_reviews.text: If you work in a commercial kitchen, you know how caustic detergent can be on your skin. Add to that the use of steel wool to scrub stubborn buildup on stainless steel pots and pans. The combination of these two willha rub your fingers raw. These gloves not only prevent raw fingers but you'll be able to handle hot pots and pans too while you wash. The only concern I have for you involves the size. Tho the glove fits nicely along my arm, the gloves themselves are oversized making it difficult to pickup silverware or food caught in the drain. One thing I learned after each use, rinse the inside of the gloves thoroughly. Good glove, great price...
customer_reviews.author: Bill Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Gloves - Easy on and off even when wet
customer_reviews.text: First pair was defective. Seller immediately sent replacement without issue. Two layer gloves with black on the outside and orange on the inside. If you can see any orange from the outside, or any black from the inside you only have one layer protecting you from the harsh chemicals. I am using these gloves for handling liquid pool acid to measure and pour in the pool; cleaning the chlorinator cell with acid; and dunking the pool filter cartridge into a 14 gallon PE container with water and acid mixture for cleaning. Be sure to also wear eye and/or full face protection like I do.
customer_reviews.author: Ocean Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Way Too Large
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality gloves, but WAY TOO BIG for my hands. I'm a female with medium size hands and these gloves won't stay on they are so big. Other sellers are correct on the sizing. They are huge. Wanted them to work in my back yard gold fish pond, but they would fall off my hands into the water. I would recommend these gloves if you have large hands. Update: Seller was very good to work with on this issue.
customer_reviews.author: SC Lady

customer_reviews.title: Leaking after 2 Months of Infrequent Use
customer_reviews.text: These gloves started leaking after 2 months of infrequent use. I use them in my indigo vat dyeing to keep the dye off of my hands. In the past I’ve used kitchen gloves- which also last about two months at about 1/3 of the price. I was hoping to keep these for much longer. The material seems good quality, but clearly they are not as chemical resistant as they claim to be.
customer_reviews.author: Elk

customer_reviews.title: These are not $1 dish washing gloves.)
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be great gloves. I like the cuff to help pull them on. (These are not $1 dish washing gloves.) They are thick and because they have a different color inside it should help you tell when there is a cut or problem with the glove. I have only used them a couple times and I usually use disposal gloves. The gloves fit as a XL glove should. My only issue is removing the gloves. I hate to say it but they are tight and are actually hard to remove without a towel or something to help pull them off.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Nice rubber work gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves have not been worn yet, but they appear heavy duty enough for the job, which will be cleaning bricks with muriatic acid. They fit well up the arm, not quite to the elbow, but high enough to avoid most splashes. The XL size was large enough for hands that have worked hard for 40 years, ring size 12.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk, split, do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: I just use them to pick up chicken hay from the chicken coop. No stress in the gloves and kept indoors. Use them one a week and they split after just a few uses. Can’t believe they say these are for chemicals. I don’t eve use them for the chickens. Do not buy...
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Finn

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I just received my pair today. They are a little bigger than I thought, but that's OK. They seem very sturdy and thick. I mainly will use them for washing our dishes as the store bought ones are much too small. These grip fairly well when wet and provide some protection against hot water and pokey forks. After I use them for a while I'll revisit my review should any changes be required.
customer_reviews.author: G. Ginn

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty gloves
customer_reviews.text: These appear to be well made, heavy duty gloves that will protect your hands from chemicals. Maybe I am not using them for the right purpose, as I am trying to use them for dishwashing. These would be 5 star for me if they had a little more texture on the fingertips and thumb and also if they were just a little more “sticky.” Overall, a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Lim

customer_reviews.title: Appear to be a nice quality product.
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be really good quality, & should function well. They arrived really quickly too. Haven’t actually used them yet, but I have tried them on,& they fit as I had hoped . I have large hands & they are even a little larger than normal large size, but they are flexible enough to be able to use your fingers with good flexibility. The length reaches up to my elbows, which is just what I needed. These seem like a real nice quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Leitko

customer_reviews.title: Too slippery inside
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get to use the product. I returned them. They are too slippery on the inside so they didnt grip my fingers to stay in place on my fingers. There was an inch at least between the tip of the glove and the tip of my finger. I wasnt comfortable trying to make it work and I would be handling chemicals. They would have been comfortable & fine other than the grip issue
customer_reviews.author: beejohnson

customer_reviews.title: Big, but they're good protection
customer_reviews.text: I'm a woman with smallish hands, and the 14" size is really big, so I had to get the hang of them. But they do offer excellent protection against the harsh cleaning products I use. They do the job. I'm pretty used to gloves not fitting like (ahem) a glove, so it's not a big deal to me. I'd buy these again. They are very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: TheBanshee

customer_reviews.title: barback's best friend
customer_reviews.text: I work in a bar, but I'm allergic to limes. These gloves get a little sweaty, but let me do my job without my hands breaking out in a rash. So far they've been pretty durable, I wash them quickly between tasks and roll them up when I'm done. My only regret with my purchase is that I bought a large size when I probably should've gotten a medium or small.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Stuart Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I needed! Product is as described! I work with a variety of corrosive acids, and these gloves are definitely doing what they are supposed to! I make sure to take care of them after working, wash rinse, hang to dry! They are holding up to the acids I use, with no sign of wear, tear, or puncture! I definitely recommend these for use with chemicals/acids! Very comfy and fit well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for Moderately Harmful Chemicals
customer_reviews.text: They are what you expect of a heavy latex gloves. I used these to handle Methanol, catalyst, TSP, and other hazardous chemicals. Now I never got burned, however I never actually spilled chemicals on these gloves. It's tough to say whether I'd trust them, but they did what they needed to do in a bind. I'd recommend these for "softer" hazards, but I wouldn't give my blessing on using them on more significantly dangerous chems.
customer_reviews.author: Noah J.

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves that seem to hold up at work.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for work shifts when something needs to be done with cleaning. They work well. Thick enough and they keep your hands dry. That is all that I need. I feel they are fairly comfortable, and I had no problems picking things up with them. A bit big maybe for small hands I guess, but that is a small complaint here.
customer_reviews.author: CrankTop Contributor: Rock Music

customer_reviews.title: Perfect homebrewing gloves!
customer_reviews.text: If you homebrew, then know that most of your time is spent cleaning. These gloves are perfect for washing kettles and gear; they protect your hands and arms from hot water and cleaning chemicals, and are comfortable... but one note; I am 6'4" and have big hands. These gloves have big finger holes and might not be so great for "normal" sized hands. This is my second set. I won't use anything else.
customer_reviews.author: R. S. Ishler

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: These are much larger than I'd hoped they'd be, but they are definitely durable and have the protective quality that I was looking for. Nice and thick. Durable. Tear resistant. Heat resistant. Chemical resistant. Can use these whenever you need to protect your hands/skin.
customer_reviews.author: The Bull

customer_reviews.title: Ginormous !
customer_reviews.text: These are not for ladies hands. I bought these for cleaning so water didn't get inside the gloves. The length is great but they are huge and basically fall off me. I'm a medium size women's glove size. Just FYI ladies they are for dude hands.
customer_reviews.author: Gamermomstl

customer_reviews.title: Purchased to use at the Crater of Diamonds State Park ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to use at the Crater of Diamonds State Park while washing off our soil at the wash stations. It was November, freezing, and everyone was jealous!!! My hands were still a little cold, but nothing compared to the folks with no protection. I could stay and wash in the freezing water for hours while they had to alternate and thaw out their fingers.
customer_reviews.author: k s 4 2 4 4

customer_reviews.title: Work for what I needed them too
customer_reviews.text: I needed some gloves that I could use while taking some stones in and out of muriatic acid. This did the trick. I was able to grip the smooth, flat (calcite) well and the gloves went high enough up my arm to protect them from splashes. I have only used them once, for a couple hours of work, but so far I am happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: YL

customer_reviews.title: Good for many applications I'd say.
customer_reviews.text: I like that they seem pretty heavy duty... I first used them in mud... Then Acetone on the 2nd use and they were just fine. Didn't rate warmth as it's summer here... Nor have I handled anything hot so I didn't rate that either. Good buy for the $$!
customer_reviews.author: James Mackinnon

customer_reviews.title: One size DOESN’T fit all
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’11” and 180lbs with decently thick hands/sausage fingers. These gloves were huge and like another reviewer stated, you lose much dexterity with these to the point where they are unusable, hence the 2 stars. If you’re 6’0”+ or have a larger build with THICK fingers, then these might for you.
customer_reviews.author: ABD

customer_reviews.title: they are heavy duty and nice and long
customer_reviews.text: my son wore these to cut down a very prickly tree. he is 6 ft 6 in so he needed that length. it served its purpose. he took them home with him so he can use them for other things.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: I used them one time then put them in storage in the shed over the winter and the next year I pulled them out and they had cracked all over the place. outside the return window and they are completely useless after VERY light use and only a year
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: I hope your hands are the size of Andre the Giant's
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself to have average size hands as an adult male. These gloves are unusable unless you have freakishly large hands. Each finger on the glove has an extra half inch to inch of empty space when worn properly. My hands get sweaty quickly which results in them falling off after about 5 minutes of trying to "work" in them. Which is a shame because I like the gloves look and feel, it's just is way too big. Do not buy. Wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Sister C

customer_reviews.title: Throw away product
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality rubber, used once to pick leaves out of small fish pond (only 4' diameter) and now the rubber has multiple large cracks. Gloves have been stored indoors, have not been exposed to direct sunlight, and never exposed to any chemicals.
customer_reviews.author: Santa Fe Lady

customer_reviews.title: They worked great for that
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to protect my hands while mixing and pouring concrete.They worked great for that.The only problem I had was after washing them off a few times my hands were soaking wet inside the gloves.I checked to see if I had torn them and there were no holes.I am glad I was not using them for a strong chemical.I wear a xxl glove and had to put a little bit of powder in to get them on.Otherwise I think they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Big and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The size of these gloves IS accurately described. Despite their being three sizes too big for me, they are remarkably comfortable. They work well in keeping unpleasant chemicals away from the skin. These gloves seem to have chlorinated latex finish, as they feel very smooth inside, with no tendency to grab.
customer_reviews.author: LeatherHarold

customer_reviews.title: Finally tough gloves
customer_reviews.text: I used to spend alot of money replacing store bought gloves to wash dishes because they would ways tear....Not anymore! These are really durable, i get no water in, they go far enough up my arms, and my silver wear /knives dont break them. UPDATE: I ruined my last pair cutting it with a razor - Bought a second pair! Very good quality and will not fail unless you bring a razor /blender blade to ruin it. (my fault)
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: Holy cow! Wayy above my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Best rubber gloves ever. They are super good quality. I am able to grab everything without trouble and best of all; I bought the long ones and they go above my elbows and will stay up without crawling down my arm. They don't make my arms or hands sweat. Don't think about it anymore...these are the ones to buy. Industrial quality for sure!
customer_reviews.author: ShadowMan

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my boyfriend because he has to have gloves on for asking the dishes ! He likes durable ,long gloves to protect his forearms. Don’t know about the durability yet but 8 think they will be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth C.

customer_reviews.title: Way Too Big and NO Grippy Surface
customer_reviews.text: These were GIANT and they had no grip whatsoever on the finger surfaces, so as soon as they were wet, they were extremely slick. Look at Lamont Gloves (see my review), which I ordered after returning these.
customer_reviews.author: Keith R. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful Of Spontaneous Tears!!
customer_reviews.text: I used these gloves one winter when I would winterized our salt water pool, cleaning the salt generator and switching to chlorine tablets. The following winter I noticed there was a big tear in one glove from deterioration of the material. Luckily I noticed it before acid washing our salt generator! Glad my hand wasn’t bathed in muriatic acid! Beware of spontaneous tears in these gloves!!
customer_reviews.author: Hajis

customer_reviews.title: Good for huge hands
customer_reviews.text: Since the virus, I cannot find the chemical gloves we normally buy for doing dishes. These were way too big for our dainty hands. They are however, very good gloves for the person who need really big gloves for certain jobs.
customer_reviews.author: All pets are rescues

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves to cover up my arms so I could clear a patch of poison ivy. I wanted something that covered way up my sleeves. I wore a pair of jersey gloves on top of these for better grip of the plants. I threw those out when I was finished then washed these really well, hung them to dry. Ready for their next adventure! Good sturdy gloves! Best thing is, so far no poison ivy!
customer_reviews.author: Geo Up North

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for gloves that were both thick and big enough to fit my hands. These fit the bill on both accounts. I am refinishing a china hutch and this requires me to work with a chemical stripper inside some confined spaces. These gloves are long enough for me to reach into the cabinet and work with the chemicals without worrying about them dripping on my forearms.
customer_reviews.author: AZPatrick

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for car washing
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gloves for washing cars in my heated garage. These are unlined and flexible. They seem to be thick enough they won`t puncture. I don`t know how they would be in freezing temps. Large enough to go up my forearm over my sleeves. These are very handy gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Hammen

customer_reviews.title: Hole in glove
customer_reviews.text: Took 15 minutes cleaning bricks with muratic acid for hole to spring in middle of palm. Didn't last any longer than thinner yellow rubber dollar store gloves essentially. A chain is only as strong as it's weakest link and a glove can't protect a hand from chemicals with a leak. Maybe it is lysol resistant.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Very well made.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best chemical-resistant gloves I've owned. They are a heavy-weight material without being too heavy. I have large hands; these fit, as intended, with some room to spare. Expect many years of use from these.
customer_reviews.author: James Hall

customer_reviews.title: As advertised!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit well, loose enough to easily remove without "peeling" off but plenty of dexterity for handling small items. I bought them mainly to keep my hands from freezing when plunging them into ice cold water when cleaning out the pool skimmers in the winter. So far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: S. Leavelle

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I used this product in my saltwater fish tank for moving sharp rocks and dealing with my anemones. The ony thing I would change about this product would be additional sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: I need to wear gloves washing dishes
customer_reviews.text: I was using disposable but during Carona the brands I like where out of stock. I bough two different brands and really like these. Dexterity is a little hard separating but I have a scratch proof tool that lets me separate them. Having two every 3 days I turn a pair inside out and just wash it like my hands and use the next pair.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Parr

customer_reviews.title: Does its job like it should.
customer_reviews.text: Tore one glove on a nail, great gloves, just be careful when using them for dirty demo work. Duct tape will stick to them, which is a bonus when attaching a to a disposable cover all (Scott pro-grade). I'll buy again, great finger dexterity as well, not too ridgid, allows for good movement and grasp.
customer_reviews.author: Simon B.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty work gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are very heavy, high-quality work gloves. I have large hands and still they fit pretty loose but workable.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Buys-a-Lot

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: Plenty big enough for me- I have found other "extra large" gloves a bit tight, but these are fine. Durable enough for any inside work, but I have not tried them yet for outside work. (The rash on my arms makes me wish I had.)
customer_reviews.author: Tom the Bomb

customer_reviews.title: Quality for this price
customer_reviews.text: They are hot while working in them. Once you take them off it is very difficult to get them back on due to the perspiration left inside the glove.
customer_reviews.author: P S Mizell

customer_reviews.title: Larger than you think
customer_reviews.text: I have large hands and these are super loose. You don’t have much dexterity with them at all. Maybe need to wear some other gloves underneath? Otherwise they seem a good thickness and seem protective.
customer_reviews.author: M. U. N.

customer_reviews.title: Not made to last
customer_reviews.text: These don’t even hold up to regular cleaning chemicals, anything stronger and you’d be buying these every couple months If not sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: Gloves lasted 4 hours before chemical sealer burned through
customer_reviews.text: Sealing limestone project using bucket and sponge. After 4 hours the gloves were clearly effected and deformed by the sealant. 30 minutes later one glove completely ripped open. If you have a big project find a more heavy duty product or plan on purchasing multiple pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Gloves for King Kong only
customer_reviews.text: GIGANTIC GLOVE USELESS FOR ME I WEAR A MENS LARGE IN ALL GLOVES 99% OF LARGE ARE VERY SNUG ON ME THESE FALL OFF MY HANDS COMPLETELY USELESS
customer_reviews.author: TR

customer_reviews.title: A very good pair of gloves
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the purchase. Good quality. I wish they had a smaller size. This one is a bit too big for my hands. But I am keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Satheesh

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are what I expected. Heavy duty for tough work, heat resistant and comfortable. The length is good too. It covers most of your arm. Good product and good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the water and cold off your arms and hands.
customer_reviews.text: This are very good for reaching into our waterfall/pond and grabbing things. They are too slick on the fingers to grab leaves on the pump suction, but still very handy.
customer_reviews.author: jP.

customer_reviews.title: The material doesn't grip
customer_reviews.text: the gloves are a bit beyond elbow length for me. I was using them for a sterile glove box, and the gloves had minimal grip, so they proved to be nearly unusable for my anticipated application. more for handling compost, sewage, or just caustic chemicals, not holding glassware!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of buying cheap gloves that fall apart after a few uses so I purchased these. They are extremely well made and should last a long long time! Great for anytime you have to use harsh or corrosive cleaners or chemicals.
customer_reviews.author: Retired

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves but VERY BIG.
customer_reviews.text: VERY BIG gloves but was able to use them to work on getting rid of my Poison Oak. I used the Round-up GEL to put on the leaves.. Seems to work well & I'd NOT have dared to use that poison unless I had these heavy gloves.
customer_reviews.author: sweetie955

customer_reviews.title: Thx Toms heavy duty gloves really give you a hand
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about this product from the ease of taking them off and putting them on.I especially liked the fact that if you get water on the inside of them you can get the water out and they can be dried and do not become mildewed like other and more expensive gloves I purchased in the past.I use the gloves mostly for household cleaning chores.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Turner

customer_reviews.title: good for BBQ
customer_reviews.text: I know that these gloves are intended for use with caustic chemicals be we found they came in handy when dealing with a large pork shoulder and pulling pork once they were sufficiently sanitized.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty gloves
customer_reviews.text: I got these to add to my solvent based parts washer/tub. Plenty thick and seem durable. So far the solvent has not deteriorated them.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Barrett

customer_reviews.title: the best to ride in the rain
customer_reviews.text: Im using them to ride motorcycle in the rain ,i dont hv water going up my sleve ,roomy enough to have liner ,so warm and comfy
customer_reviews.author: art

customer_reviews.title: Gloves Seem Fine
customer_reviews.text: Gloves seem fine. They seem a little slippery, as if they won't allow you to hold tight to something, but in fact that does not happen. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: E D

customer_reviews.title: Very good glove...sturdy and durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for his job in maintenance...they're very good sturdy gloves...just to large in the hand area part for hand size...and he's 30yrs old.
customer_reviews.author: Lucyna Evans

customer_reviews.title: Durable heavy rubber.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. The 18” length was plenty for me (5’11” male) and reached up to my elbows. Plenty flexible and heavy so no fear of punctures.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hurd

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice For Me
customer_reviews.text: Many reviewers commented that the gloves are to large. I have large hands and the fit is just perfect. Good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I have large fingers and find there is a little too much room for my fingers to pick up small items. On the other hand (no pun intended) I find the gloves comfortable and sturdy. Overall a functional glove at a very affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: TRex

customer_reviews.title: Sizing need improvement. They fit way too big for my US Large hand.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves feel quality made. But the sizing will be need to improve. I wear most US Large in gloves. They fit like XL. Totally unwearable for me that it just slide off.
customer_reviews.author: Yimmiyo

customer_reviews.title: Way too big!!!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely heavy duty but one size does not fit all as the gloves were way too big for my hands. I returned them for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Vaninha

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves! I use them to clean my fish tank and they definitely keep my hands and arms dry!
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: They were a little too big but work fine.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty gloves. I use them to get the basket out of the pool skimmer, especially when it's overtaken by algae.
customer_reviews.author: Arman Mnatsakanyan

customer_reviews.title: Durable gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are super durable and exactly what I wanted. I didn't pay attention to the size and they are definitely too big for me, but does what it needs to do.
customer_reviews.author: Swp22

customer_reviews.title: Slippery when wet.  No grip.
customer_reviews.text: Very slippery if they wet. Item might fall off your hand as they have no grip structure in the palm.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Easy on and off!
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves for handling chemicals used on my yard! The large size makes it easy to get them on and off.
customer_reviews.author: David K

customer_reviews.title: Wow!! SMH !!
customer_reviews.text: If I had seen the " green giant " comment ( died laughing ) I wouldn't have purchased. Saying that my boyfriend doesn't have huge hands but they're fairly manly and these literally were falling off his hands. So I doubt that washing or holding any items that are fragile or breakable, with these will require him to have mad " rugby like " skills. So these reviews may be relative to the person and purpose intended!! As for me " oh no !!
customer_reviews.author: Nat..!!!

customer_reviews.title: Super Slippery
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised no one else has mentioned this. The gloves have no grip. They're so slippery that I gave up on using them 15 mins into trying to hold onto a metal broom handle.
customer_reviews.author: Adam A.

customer_reviews.title: An essential part of any mad scientist's wardrobe.
customer_reviews.text: Tend to make my hands sweaty and it runs a little on the large side so watch out which size you order but overall these work pretty well. Honestly I ordered it as part of a costume so I can't say how well it really protects but it is nice and thick and I have no doubt it would do the job well.
customer_reviews.author: Beef5718

customer_reviews.title: Good material
customer_reviews.text: I used these for a ghost busters costume. They are huge they slide of my hands but they are of good material, but I wouldn't use this for their"intended purpose" they are flimsy and they do tear easily
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Keep your sleeves dry
customer_reviews.text: Getting the longer version keeps me from getting water in the glove or gettIng my sleeve wet. These look funny but work GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: J. Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and thick rubber
customer_reviews.text: Thick good quality and durable. I used them for a still air box for mycology and they work great!
customer_reviews.author: jeanpaul

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Quality and Workmanship
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are Outstanding! Highest Quality and Workmanship! Used for Dishwashing! Ordering another for house cleaning and another for toilet cleaning!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable. Comes XL
customer_reviews.text: Gloves would be considered XL,XXL. Fit me perfect used for Etching my garage floor with Muratic Acid. Comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Must-have for RV camping!! Long enough to make sure any spills don't get where you don't want them
customer_reviews.text: I use these to hook up and unhook our RV water and sewer hoses. They go almost to my elbows, so any spillage is sure to never get inside the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Braden

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: Came with small holes that were not noticeable until getting them wet so test before using any types of hazardous applications. Started to work with an acidic wash and got 10 minutes in before hands started burning.
customer_reviews.author: William Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: They could be better
customer_reviews.text: I work at a deli department and I do the cleaning part when we close the store and I mostly use this to wash dishes and skewers. I normally use this about 3hrs daily, but after they start ripping apart it had a hole already, plus I dont think is strong enough for doing things like washing dishes and working with chemicals
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Safe but not for heat.
customer_reviews.text: Good for chemical protection but is not that great for handling hot fluids.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Downing

customer_reviews.title: Thick and protective.
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy duty set of gloves. A little clunky on the flexibility of the fingers, but that's OK and expected because of the thickness. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jither

product_meta.title: ThxToms Heavy Duty Latex Gloves, Resist Strong Acid, Alkali and Oil, 14", 1 Pair
feature_bullets: High-grade natural latex possess a excellent chemical resistance and tear resistance
Ideal thickness provide a fantastic secure protection yet still tactile sensitive
Only one size - extra large, but its smooth finish provides excellent grip
3 kinds length choices are better to protect your forearm and arm
Used for machine repair, yard work, aquarium, chemical processing, laboratory and more
